title: How to Find a Users SID on Windows

steps.title: Press ⊞ Win+X.
steps.content: Press ⊞ Win + X . This opens the Windows “power user” menu at the bottom-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Click Command Prompt (Admin).
steps.content: Click Command Prompt (Admin) . A confirmation message will appear.

steps.title: Click Yes.
steps.content: Click Yes . Now you'll see a terminal window displaying the command prompt.

steps.title: Type WMIC useraccount get name,sid.
steps.content: Type WMIC useraccount get name,sid . This is the command to display the SIDs of all user accounts on the system. If you know the person's username, use this command instead: wmic useraccount where name="USER" get sid (but replace USER with the username). [1] X Research source

steps.title: Press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Press ↵ Enter . The SID is the long number that appears after each username.
